com.github.triceo.splitlog.api

Interface CommonFollower<P extends MessageProducer<P>,C extends MessageProducer<C>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MessageConsumer<C>, MessageListener<C>, MessageProducer<P>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Follower, MergingFollower

    public interface CommonFollower<P extends MessageProducer<P>,C extends MessageProducer<C>>
extends MessageProducer<P>, MessageConsumer<C>
    Follower's primary function is to allow users to work with their portion of the tailed log file. It provides means for a blocking wait for particular chunks, and can also send these chunks to output. Messages get into the follower when LogWatch notifies it of them. Alternatively, each Follower.tag(String) will create a Message within the follower and not notify anyone.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages()
        Retrieve all MessageDeliveryStatus.ACCEPTED messages that this follower has been notified of, and tags. They will appear in the order in which we have been notified of them.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of, and tags.

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages(MessageComparator order)
        Retrieve all MessageDeliveryStatus.ACCEPTED messages that this follower has been notified of, and tags, in a given order.
        Parameters:
        order - The comparator that will be used to order the messages.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of, and tags.

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages(SimpleMessageCondition condition)
        Retrieve all MessageDeliveryStatus.ACCEPTED messages that this follower has been notified of, if a certain condition holds true for them, and tags. They will be in the order given.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of, for which the condition holds true, and tags.

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages(SimpleMessageCondition condition,
                             MessageComparator order)
        Retrieve all MessageDeliveryStatus.ACCEPTED messages that this follower has been notified of, if a certain condition holds true for them, and tags. They will be in the order in which we have been notified of them.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition.
        order - The comparator that will be used to order the messages.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of, for which the condition holds true, and tags.

      • mergeWith

        MergingFollower mergeWith(Follower f)
        Merge this CommonFollower with another. This CommonFollower has a responsibility of notifying the resulting MergingFollower of every Message that it receives, until such time that MergingFollower.separate(Follower) is called on it.
        Parameters:
        f - To merge with.
        Returns:
        A new MergingFollower, that will merge both CommonFollowers. If any of the CommonFollowers already is a MergingFollower, the returned instance will hold every merged CommonFollower individually and not compose MergingFollowers.

      • mergeWith

        MergingFollower mergeWith(MergingFollower f)
        Merge this CommonFollower with another. This CommonFollower has a responsibility of notifying the resulting MergingFollower of every Message that it receives, until such time that MergingFollower.separate(Follower) is called on it.
        Parameters:
        f - To merge with.
        Returns:
        A new MergingFollower, that will merge both CommonFollowers. If any of the CommonFollowers already is a MergingFollower, the returned instance will hold every merged CommonFollower individually and not compose MergingFollowers.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if written, false otherwise.

      • expect

        Future<Message> expect(C condition)
        Will return a future that will only return when a message arrives that makes the given condition return true.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the future to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().

      • expect

        Future<Message> expect(C condition,
                     MessageAction<S> action)
        Will return a future that will only return when a message arrives that makes the given condition return true, at which point it asynchronously executes a particular action. It will not return until that action has finished executing.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the future to unblock.
        action - Action to execute when the condition becomes true.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().

      • waitFor

        @Deprecated
Message waitFor(C condition)
        Deprecated. 
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().

      • waitFor

        @Deprecated
Message waitFor(C condition,
                         long timeout,
                         TimeUnit unit)
        Deprecated. 
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true. If none arrives before the timeout, it unblocks anyway.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        timeout - Time before forcibly aborting.
        unit - Unit of time.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When already #isStopped().
